job_description:
Senior DevSecOps Engineer

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and foster a secure-by-design culture. You will collaborate with engineering, product, and leadership teams to ensure systems, applications, and cloud environments are secure, reliable, and future-ready.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct security risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and execute mitigation plans.
  • Architect and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance and governance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture, ensuring secure design and development practices.
  • Monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats, incidents, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures on AWS, Azure, or GCP for scalable, compliant deployments.
  • Build and secure containerized environments with Docker and Kubernetes using enforced security baselines.
  • Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems for infrastructure and applications.
  • Improve system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance across critical workloads.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development, automation, and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, process improvements, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security, performance, and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with strong security exposure.
  • Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions).
  • Expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP cloud platforms with a focus on secure architecture.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Strong understanding of networking technologies (LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers).
  • Knowledge of security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Experience with monitoring/logging tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM).
  • Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash, Shell).
  • Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication and collaboration abilities to influence engineering teams.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior DevSecOps Engineer leads security, infrastructure automation, and cloud practices. Ensures secure-by-design culture through collaboration with engineering teams.

job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

At 2Base, we are rebuilding the Business Analyst function into a world-class, product-minded, clarity-driven team. This role is not a documentation role, not a screen updater role, and not a support role. This is a core Business Analyst position responsible for functional modeling, system reasoning, requirement clarity, and building the foundation for correct development.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviors, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviors, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.
  • Candidates must align with 2Base’s structured thinking, clarity-driven culture, and transformation of the BA function.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst role focused on functional modeling, requirement clarity, and cross-team collaboration to drive aligned, testable development outcomes.

job_description:
Business Analyst

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs
  • Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented
  • Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation
  • Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them
  • Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams
  • Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams
  • Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle
  • Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements
  • Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation
  • Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines
  • Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details
  • Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation
  • Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements

Required Skills and Experience

  • 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles
  • Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation
  • Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control
  • Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly
  • Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes
  • Experience with project management systems and documentation tools
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel
  • Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
  • 1 to 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Translates business needs into structured documentation for software development. Ensures clarity, traceability, and alignment across requirements and stakeholder deliverables.

job_description:
L2 SOC Security Analyst

Location: From Kochi Office (Onsite) Office: ART Technologies and Software

Job Summary

The L2 Security Analyst is responsible for performing advanced incident analysis, investigating security escalations from L1 analysts, conducting vulnerability assessments, and actively supporting threat hunting and malware analysis. This role acts as a critical link within the SOC by coordinating incident response efforts, ensuring compliance with security frameworks, and enhancing the organization's cybersecurity posture through diligent monitoring and remediation activities.

Key Responsibilities

  • Monitor, analyze, and respond to alerts generated by firewalls, proxy servers, and intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS).
  • Perform rule tuning and assist in configuration adjustments of firewall, proxy, and IDS devices.
  • Handle escalations from L1 analysts and conduct in-depth investigations of security incidents and alerts.
  • Perform comprehensive log analysis, root cause analysis, threat hunting, and forensic examinations.
  • Coordinate with stakeholders across IT, security, and business units to implement incident response and remediation.
  • Execute vulnerability assessments using tools like Nessus and Qualys; manage patching activities in coordination with relevant teams.
  • Participate in continuous threat hunting exercises and malware analysis to identify emerging threats.
  • Ensure adherence to security policies, standards, and regulatory frameworks such as ISO 27001, PCI DSS, and GDPR.
  • Maintain and update incident response playbooks; contribute to SOC process improvements.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentoring to L1 analysts.
  • Prepare detailed incident reports and documentation for stakeholders.

Required Experience and Qualifications

  • 2 to 5 years of experience in cybersecurity operations, SOC, or IT infrastructure security.
  • Proven expertise with SIEM platforms (e.g., Splunk, QRadar), endpoint protection, and threat detection solutions.
  • Hands-on experience with vulnerability management tools such as Nessus, Qualys, or equivalent.
  • Familiarity with regulatory standards and compliance requirements (ISO 27001, PCI DSS, GDPR preferred).
  • Relevant security certifications such as CEH, CompTIA Security+, or equivalent are highly desirable.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
  • Effective communication skills with ability to liaise across technical and non-technical teams.

Preferred Skills

  • Knowledge of malware analysis and computer forensic techniques.
  • Experience with scripting languages (Python, Bash) for automation and security tool enhancement.
  • Understanding of network security protocols and firewall management.
  • Ability to work collaboratively under pressure in a fast-paced, 24/7 operational environment.

Contact: For inquiries, reach out to lavanya.a@arttechgroup.com.
summary: The L2 SOC Security Analyst performs advanced incident analysis, threat hunting, and ensures compliance with security frameworks. They coordinate incident response and enhance cybersecurity posture through monitoring and remediation.

job_title: Immediate Opening For Principal Architect -AI & Agentic AI
job_description:
Role Overview

Principal Architect - AI & Agentic AI

Experience: 14-18 Years Location: Bangalore/Chennai/Kochi Notice Period: Immediate to 30 Days

Provide enterprise-level technical leadership for designing and scaling advanced AI solutions across predictive analytics, computer vision, NLP, and Agentic AI systems. Own the AI architecture vision and ensure alignment with business strategy, scalability, and responsible AI principles.

Tech Stack

AI & Machine Learning

  • Programming Languages: Python
  • Deep Learning Frameworks (Must): PyTorch, TensorFlow
  • Computer Vision: OpenCV, scikit-image, Pillow
  • Model Architectures: CNNs, ResNet, EfficientNet, Vision Transformers (ViT), YOLO, Faster R-CNN, Mask R-CNN
  • Video & Streaming: OpenCV Video I/O, FFmpeg, GStreamer
  • Edge & Optimization: TensorRT, ONNX, OpenVINO
  • Annotation Tools: Label Studio, CVAT
  • Deployment: TorchServe, TensorFlow Serving, Triton Inference Server

NLP & Generative AI

  • Programming Languages: Python
  • Deep Learning Frameworks (Must): PyTorch, TensorFlow
  • NLP Libraries: Hugging Face Transformers, spaCy, NLTK
  • LLM & GenAI: Transformers, RAG pipelines, fine-tuned LLMs
  • Vector Databases: FAISS, Pinecone, Weaviate
  • Text Processing: SentencePiece, Byte-Pair Encoding (BPE)
  • Search & Retrieval: ElasticSearch, OpenSearch
  • Evaluation & Explainability: SHAP, LIME, BLEU, ROUGE
  • Deployment: FastAPI, TorchServe, TensorFlow Serving

Responsibilities

  • AI Strategy & Architecture: Define and govern enterprise-wide AI architecture across predictive analytics, computer vision, NLP, generative, and agentic AI systems.
  • Predictive & Advanced Analytics: Lead design and deployment of forecasting, anomaly detection, optimization, and recommendation models with robust evaluation and explainability.
  • Computer Vision: Architect and optimize computer vision solutions including object detection, segmentation, OCR, and video analytics.
  • NLP & Generative AI: Design NLP and LLM-based systems for search, extraction, summarization, conversational AI, and multimodal use cases.
  • Agentic AI Systems: Architect autonomous and semi-autonomous agentic systems with planning, tool use, memory, orchestration, and human-in-the-loop controls.
  • MLOps & AI Platform: Establish MLOps standards for model versioning, CI/CD, monitoring, drift detection, retraining, and scalable AI platform services.
  • Responsible AI & Governance: Define and enforce Responsible AI practices including fairness, bias mitigation, explainability, transparency, privacy, security, model risk management, and regulatory compliance.
  • Risk, Security & Compliance: Ensure AI systems meet enterprise security standards, data protection requirements, and regulatory obligations.
  • Cross-Functional Leadership: Partner with product, engineering, data, legal, security, and business stakeholders to deliver AI solutions aligned with enterprise priorities.
  • Technical Mentorship & Standards: Mentor senior engineers and data scientists; define architectural, modeling, and coding standards.
  • Innovation & Thought Leadership: Drive experimentation, POCs, and adoption of emerging AI technologies while evaluating risk, value, and operational readiness.

Contact Information

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at Keerthana.jayaraj@aspiresys.com.
summary: Lead enterprise AI architecture for scalable solutions in predictive analytics, computer vision, NLP, and agentic systems. Ensure alignment with business strategy and responsible AI practices through cross-functional collaboration.

About Us

We are a fast-growing, product-based company developing a multi-organization ERP and CRM platform for the education sector. Our solutions help schools, colleges, and universities streamline operations, improve collaboration, and manage multiple campuses efficiently. With a strong focus on usability, scalability, and innovation, we enable educational institutions to operate smarter and deliver better outcomes.

Role Overview

We are seeking a Senior SEO Specialist with 4+ years of experience to drive international search visibility across multiple regions and platforms. This role focuses on global SEO strategy, Generative Engine Optimization (GEO), technical SEO, authoritative content creation, and high-quality link building. You will collaborate with content and development teams to optimize site architecture, improve discoverability in traditional and AI-driven search engines, and translate technical concepts into search-optimized content.

Responsibilities

  1. International & Multi-Regional SEO
  2. Manage SEO for international domains (ccTLDs, subdomains, or subdirectories) with complex hreflang implementations.
  3. Monitor global search trends and execute strategies for visibility across time zones and cultural contexts.

  4. Conduct market-specific keyword research to capture regional search intent and cultural nuances.

  5. Generative Engine Optimization (GEO)

  6. Optimize website architecture and content for AI-driven search engines and "AI Overviews".

  7. Focus on brand citations, entity authority, and semantic relevance for LLM recommendations.

  8. High-Impact Outreach & Link Building

  9. Lead international outreach campaigns to acquire high-authority backlinks from global publications and niche sites.

  10. Build relationships with international webmasters and influencers for a diverse link profile.

  11. Technical Content Writing

  12. Create and edit technical content (whitepapers, blogs, documentation) that is SEO-friendly and authoritative.

  13. Translate complex technical features into benefit-driven copy for developers and B2B decision-makers.

  14. Technical & On-Page SEO

  15. Conduct site health audits focusing on Core Web Vitals, schema markup (JSON-LD), and crawlability.
  16. Collaborate with dev teams to implement technical recommendations across international subdomains.

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Experience: 4+ years in a dedicated SEO role with international project management.
  • GEO Mastery: Deep understanding of AI engine optimization and "citatability".
  • Content Prowess: Exceptional technical writing skills in English (human-first, SEO-second).
  • Technical Stack: Proficiency in GA4, Google Search Console, Ahrefs, Semrush, Screaming Frog, WordPress/CMS.
  • Outreach: Experience with BuzzStream, Hunter.io, or manual PR outreach.
  • Attributes: Self-starter mindset, cross-time zone collaboration, and remote team coordination.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Python for SEO or automated data collection.
  • HTML/CSS/JavaScript knowledge for SEO performance.
  • Certification in Advanced SEO or Google Analytics.

How to Apply

Apply via Career Estrrado or email your resume to career@estrrado.com with the subject line: SEO Specialist.
summary: Senior SEO Specialist with 4+ years of experience required to drive global SEO strategy, GEO, and technical content optimization for an education ERP/CRM platform.
